Divisions — All divisions on record

A 'division' is parliamentary terminology for a 'vote' (read more...). This page shows divisions in the Australian parliament. Make sure you read the explanation about rebellions, as they may not be what you expect.

Sort by: Date | Subject | Rebellions | Turnout

House Date Time Subject Rebels
(explain..) 		Majority Turnout
Representatives 14 Mar 2013 10:56 test 0 1 100.0%
Senate 14 Mar 2013 Motions — Renewable Energy Certificates 0 3 100.0%
Senate 30 Dec 2009 12:00 Proceedural ban of flatulence during divisions 0 9 97.1%
Senate 30 Nov 2009 12:00 Carbon Pollution Reduction Scheme (Cprs Fuel Credits) Bill 2009 [No. 2]; Carbon Pollution Reduction Scheme Amendment (Household Assistance) Bill 2009 [No. 2] — Third Reading 1 9 97.1%
Senate 25 Nov 2009 16:13 Carbon Pollution Reduction Scheme Legislation 11 31 86.7%
Representatives 6 Dec 2006 19:29 Prohibition of Human Cloning for Reproduction and the Regulation of Human Embryo Research Amendment Bill 2006 — Consideration in Detail 0 23 87.8%

About the Project

The Public Whip is brought to you by the not-for-profit OpenAustralia Foundation. It is based on the UK site of the same name.

If you'd like to talk to us about the project, please email us.
